slides.proj_desc: FeTurbulence is looped to slowly degrade the integrity of an svg and my laptop's heat-sink fan.

slides.alt: CSSConf17 Entry depicting a house on Bourbon Street with colorful and detailed CSS rendered street facades. This is animated & 'drawn' CSS
slides.proj_desc: A mid-century Bourbon Street scene was a contest entry at CSSConf'17 & received honorable mention in an article by codepen founder, Chris Coiyer. Completed in 3 weeks.
Animated opacity on radial-gradients to simulate waves & ripples. React state is used to trigger a disturbed chickadee's <audio> element as it files away.

slides.alt: state picker alternative to dropdown menu
slides.proj_desc: Multi-layered SVG to create a 50's retro-monitor glitch animation. Project's aim is to mitigate the alienating & brutalist user experience of clicking through a state-picker drop-down menu.

slides.alt: image of the movie 'Up!' depicting a house flying away in with baloons on a sunny day
slides.proj_desc: Lessons to teach DOM targeting of DOM elements, event listeners, conditionals, etc. Basic principles of animation and their application to coding movement in the browser.

Coding is 80% planning, 20% typing. Most projects are planned and iterated on with an eye toward learning and implementing something yet untried. Full Low-Fidelity & high-fidelity prototypes are an integral part of my workflow.
Drawn in pure CSS, this experiment uses <audio> for immersion. Looped CSS animations and Filter effects are used on the SVGs while a looped cel animation is used to depict rainfall.

slides.alt: Code Journal image depicting SQL queries & tips and advice
slides.proj_desc: Library of code, advice, recommendations & snippets in SASS, SQL Queries, Node, GSAP, ES6, Javascript, Angular & React (currently being overhauled)

slides.alt: Retro styled panel for user inputs email, state, etc. Done in the style of Kubrick's 2001
slides.proj_desc: An aesthetic alternative to user input form & validation. This pure css panel, in tandem with the adjacent vector graphics 'monitor' is used to validate a user to a site for a company that sells robots in the private sector.

In a previous life I was obsessed with Film production, compositing, rotoscoping, color grading and sound editing. Teaching myself After Effects was my 'gate-way drug' that got me interested in learning javascript.

slides.alt: This application responsive web design in desktop, iPad & mobile
slides.proj_desc: This portfolio was built in react, hosted using nginx as a reverse proxy & uses a Let's Encrypt SSL Cert.
